member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser
member.summary: The command parser is used to take the input from the user and ascertains whether it matches syntax patterns to draw out the command name and variables. When a command has the required parameters the parser executes and logs the action as successful. The MainGUI is passed within the constructor to ensure the GUI elements are available for access dependant on the command.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.#ctor(GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.MainGUI)
member.summary: Instantiates object to enable the ability to interpretate the entries from the command line.
member.param: MainGUI passed to constructor to allow all UI objects to be available so they can be updated following actions.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.ParseCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the values from the command line and retrieves and evaluates the contents of the input from the command line.
member.param: Intended to be the input recieved from the GUI object txtCommand

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.PrepareInput(System.String)
member.summary: The 'prepareInput' method takes a string input and converts to lowercase and then removes the whitespace to ensure consistant evaluation and extraction of values.
member.param: Input recieved from the GUI object txtCommand

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.SetCommand(System.String)
member.summary: 'setCommand' uses the REGEX patterns within the class to identify inputs containing parentheses or if it is a command on its own, further verification of the command is done within the command factory.
member.param: Input recieved from the GUI object txtCommand following it being prepared.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.SetCommandVariables
member.summary: This method is used to cast the command object to the relavent command type and initiate the set method appropriately passing the variables dictionary.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.GetVariablesFromInput(System.String)
member.summary: Using the REGEX patterns the 'setVariablesFromInput method identifies whether the entered input string hold variables, whether they are inside parentheses or stand alone variables.
member.param: Input recieved from the GUI object txtCommand following it being prepared.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.SetCurrentCommand
member.summary: This method assigns the built command to the MainGUI object. The purpose of this action is to store a partially created command object and variables until they are completed and can be executed.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.ClearCurrentCommand
member.summary: As the command object within the MainGUI is used as storage for incomplete commands, this method is to clear the object and variables. This is used on execution of the completed command or if the command is changed before completed.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.CommandParser.UpdateCommandUsage
member.summary: A feature of the application is to On completion of a command the txtCommandCount GUI object is updated with a formatted string value taken from the database and ordered by the number of calls to the command.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Clear
member.summary:
The clear command is designed to take the graphic from the pnlOutput within the MainGui object and clears anything that had been added to it.
Syntax example : clear

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Clear.hasRequiredParameters
member.summary: HasRequiredParameters returns true without any logic due to the fact the Clear command does not require any parameters. The method is implemented this way to follow the established pattern within the CommandParser class, it has the additional benefit of being able to add further logic in future if the application changes in future iterations.
member.returns: Returns true as no variables required for this action.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Clear.IsValid(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: eturns true without any logic due to the fact the Clear command does not require any parameters. The method is implemented this way to follow the established pattern within the CommandParser class, it has the additional benefit of being able to add further logic in future if the application changes in future iterations.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.
member.returns: Returns true as no variables required for this action.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Command
member.summary: The base class to all commands that are specified within the application. This class implements the ICommand interface of which only Set and Log are written, Execute, HasRequiredParameters and IsValid will left to the children of the base class.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Command.Set(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: 'Set' within this base class takes the variables provided and assigns them to the Dictionary that is defined within this class. By using a Dictiaonary and setting it at the base class it reduces the need to set multiple times and can concentrate on the logic within the child.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Command.Log(GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.MainGUI)
member.summary: The base implemetation of the Log() method is created to record when a command is called, child implementations can hold more specific information if required.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Command.Execute
member.summary: These methods have been brought in by the interface, as the class is abstract these methods are not reuqired at this level and will be implemented by children of the Command base class.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawShape
member.summary:
The draw shape command is the main call when wanting to draw any of the shapes defined within the application which are generated by the ShapeFactory. With the dictionary parameters passed to the Set method or the Constructor the values are then passed to the shape class to be populated which inturn executes.
Syntax example : Inline example drawshape(type=circle,x=2,y=2,radius=50) drawshape(type=square,x=2,y=2,length=50) Seperate example drawshape type=circle x=5 y=5 radius=50

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawShape.set(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Takes variables passed to the method from within the variables dictionary and assigns them to the relevent fields ready for execution when completed.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawShape.Execute
member.summary: Begins the command if valid and draws the defined shape to the graphic object in the MainGUI. If not valid then message added to the log.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawShape.hasRequiredParameters
member.summary: Ensures the shape object has been instansiated and then makes use of the shapes own HasRequiredParameters method as that is the object that requires the variables to successfully execute.
member.returns: Returns true if object has required parameters to build the specified shape.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawShape.IsValid(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: This method is implemented based on the shape having the correct variables and so make use of the hasRequiredParameters() method.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.
member.returns: Returns true if object has required parameters to build the specified shape.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawTo
member.summary:
The draw to command is implemented to add a graphical line from the current point on the MainGUI to x y coordinates that are passed via the Set method or on construction. This line uses the current value of the pen weight and color from the MainGUI.
Syntax example : Inline example drawto(x=20,y=20) Seperate example drawto x=5 y=5

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawTo.set(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Takes variables passed to the method from within the variables dictionary and assigns them to the relevent fields ready for execution when completed.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawTo.Execute
member.summary: Begins the command if valid and draws the line to the defined location on the graphic object in the MainGUI. If not valid then message added to the log.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawTo.hasRequiredParameters
member.summary: This implementation of the HasRequiredParameters checks the boolean values set when the coresponding x or y value are set via the parameters.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.DrawTo.IsValid(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: With the lack of additional logic requirements the IsValid method makes use of the hasRequiredParameters' method.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.
member.returns: Returns true if object has required parameters to draw to the specified location.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.MoveTo
member.summary:
The move to command is implemented to move the position from the current point on the MainGUI to x y coordinates that are passed via the Set method or on construction.
Syntax example : Inline example moveto(x=20,y=20) Seperate example moveto x=5 y=5

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.MoveTo.set(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Takes variables passed to the method from within the variables dictionary and assigns them to the relevent fields ready for execution when completed.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.MoveTo.Execute
member.summary: Begins the command if valid and moves the pen to the defined location on the graphic object in the MainGUI. If not valid then message added to the log.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.MoveTo.hasRequiredParameters
member.summary: This implementation of the HasRequiredParameters checks the boolean values set when the coresponding x or y value are set via the parameters.
member.returns: Returns true if object has required parameters to move to the specified location.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.MoveTo.IsValid(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: With the lack of additional logic requirements the IsValid method makes use of the hasRequiredParameters' method.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.
member.returns: Returns true if object has required parameters to move to the specified location.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Reset.Execute
member.summary: Begins the command if valid and sets the graphic object in the MainGUI back to the default state. This includes the position of the pen as well as the canvas being cleared. This makes use of the 'Clear' command to avoid re writing the statement. If not valid then message added to the log.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Reset.hasRequiredParameters
member.summary: HasRequiredParameters returns true without any logic due to the fact the Reset command does not require any parameters. The method is implemented this way to follow the established pattern within the CommandParser class, it has the additional benefit of being able to add further logic in future if the application changes in future iterations.
member.returns: Returns true as no variables required for this action.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.Reset.IsValid(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: IsValid returns true without any logic due to the fact the Reset command does not require any parameters. The method is implemented this way to follow the established pattern within the CommandParser class, it has the additional benefit of being able to add further logic in future if the application changes in future iterations.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.
member.returns: Returns true as no variables required for this action.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.SetFill
member.summary:
Set fill makes use of the brush object to set the color of any shapes drawn on the MainGUI's graphic. In this application it is the SolidBrush type that is used and does not offer configuration to any other type. By including a color value within the parentheses that color is used, using empty paretheses sets the fill to transparent effectively turning the fill off.
Syntax example : setfill(color=red) setfill()

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.SetFill.set(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Takes variables passed to the method from within the variables dictionary and assigns them to the relevent fields ready for execution when completed.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.SetFill.Execute
member.summary: Begins the command if valid and sets the brush object within the MainGUI to the one built wihin this class. If not valid then message added to the log.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.SetFill.hasRequiredParameters
member.summary: Checks the class to ensure it has what is required to successfully execute the action.
member.returns: Returns true as no variables required for this action to execute.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.SetFill.IsValid(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Makes use of the hasRequiredParameters method as there is no further logic required to verify the action.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.
member.returns: Returns true as no variables required for this action to execute.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.SetPen
member.summary:
A dymanic command, set pen is designed to set the color or weight of the pen by passing the name of the parameters. This means weight and color can be set separatly or as part of one call.
Syntax example : setpen(weight=3) setpen(color=red) setpen(weight=3,color=red)

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.SetPen.hasRequiredParameters
member.summary: With the command being dynamic in nature has requirements uses the OR logic between the bool variables weightset and colorset.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Commands.SetPen.IsValid(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: The validity of the command come from the correct variables and so uses hasRequiredParameters.
member.param: A dictionary object to hold string values which can be parsed where required.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Data.CommandsContext
member.summary: The access point to the GP_DATABASE which holds the count for each command invoked. Currently the connection string is hardcoded within the UseSqlServer method however this will be written and referenced from a appsettings.json file as developemnt continues.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Enums.CommandTypes
member.summary: Enum values of defined commands, these are used for consistancy throughout the application.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Enums.ShapeTypes
member.summary: Enum values of defined shapes, these are used for consistancy throughout the application.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Factories.CommandFactory
member.summary: Making use of the factory design pattern this class is created to generate commands freely available within the command parser. Enums utilised for consistent evaluations within the switch statement.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Factories.ShapeFactory
member.summary: Making use of the factory design pattern this class is created to generate shape objects freely within the draw shape class. Enums utilised for consistent evaluations within the switch statement.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Logger
member.summary: The Logger class helper is a set of staic methods that write to an exernal log.txt file held within the source files. The messages generally are designed to reflect the output of the command and also what was input.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Logger.LogLaunch
member.summary: On the launch of the application this method is called to write the event in the log.txt file as well as write to the txtLog visual control with the DateTime stamp preceeding it.
member.returns: String value intended to be used when writing to the GUI object txtLog

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Logger.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Log() writes any given string to the log.txt file and the txtLog UI control on a fresh line along with the DateTime stamp preceeding it.
member.param: String value provided to be written to the log
member.returns: String value intended to be used when writing to the GUI object txtLog

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.UsageCounter
member.summary: The UsageCounter class helper is a set of staic methods that read and write to the GPL_DATABASE held within the source files. Each method is wrapped in a context using statement to handle the resource efficiently by closing the connection after the method has been exited.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.UsageCounter.AddToCommandCount(System.String)
member.summary: Matching to the given commandName variable, this method increases the count of the record by one each time it is called.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.UsageCounter.GetUsageCountOutput
member.summary: Used within the MainGUI class GetUsageOutput() is called to provide the data from the DB in a formatted manner as well as ordered by the most recent usage count. The outputted string concatinates the CommandName followed by a tab space and then the SyntaxExample, delimited by a colon.
member.returns: List of strings which can be iterated through and added to the GUI command in the MainGUI

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Interfaces.ICommand
member.summary: The command interface holds methods used for common actions relating to a generic command.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Interfaces.IShape
member.summary: The shape interface holds methods used for common actions relating to a generic shape. CalculateArea and CalculatePerimenter are intended to be used within the override for toString() method.

member.name: T:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Models.CommandUsageCount
member.summary: The CommandUsageCount model is used to bind the entries from the database to the application. Table contains fieldsd for syntax examples which is intended to work as a reference guide for users as well as being able to be copied and pasted quickly when tested.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Program.Main
member.summary: The main entry point for the application.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.summary: Looks up a localized resource of type System.Drawing.Bitmap.

Verticle coordinate of the pen.
The expected radius of the drawn object.
The string value of a color for the line.
The string value of a color for the fill.
The width of the line.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Shapes.Circle.CalculateArea
member.summary: Calculates the area of the created shape using the PI value from the C# Math library.
member.returns: The calulated value of the area in an unrestricted decimal format.

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Shapes.Circle.CalculatePerimeter
member.summary: Calculates the perimeter of the created shape using the PI value from the C# Math library.
member.returns: The calulated value of the perimeter in an unrestricted decimal format.

member.summary: The action that adds the specified shape the MainGUI graphic object.
member.param: Graphics object, intended to be provided from the MainGUI

member.name: M:GraphicalProgrammingLanguage.Shapes.Circle.ToString
member.summary: This overrides the base implemention of ToString() in this case this is now the Shape class.

member.summary: The 'set' method uses the params in position [0] as x, [1] as y and [2] as the line weight. This virtual method can be overwritten by children of this class that can be more specfic to the shape.
